predicate.note: Frames file for 'deem' based on sentences in wsj and automatic expansion via verbnet.

example.name: value as adjective phrase
example.text: So far, Mrs. Hills hasn't deemed any cases bad enough to merit an accelerated investigation under the so-called special 301 provision of the act.
example.arg: bad enough to merit an accelerated investigation under the so-called special 301 provision of the act

example.name: value as infinitive clause
example.text: In one feature, called ``In the Dumpster,'' editors point out a product *trace* they deem *trace* to be a particularly bad offender.
example.arg: to be a particularly bad offender

example.name: with passive extraction
example.text: Those countries -- including Japan, Italy, Canada, Greece and Spain -- are still of some concern to the U.S. but are deemed *trace* to pose less-serious problems for American patent and copyright owners than those on the ``priority'' list.
example.arg: *trace* -> Those countries -- including Japan, Italy, Canada, Greece and Spain --
to pose less-serious problems for American patent and copyright owners than those on the ``priority'' list
